conclusion: Consider the motion of the charged particle in both the electric and magnetic fields.
The particle is launched horizontally with velocity v_0.
The electric field E acts vertically downwards, causing the particle to accelerate downwards with an acceleration a = qE/m.
Time t to reach P is t = s/v_0.
Vertical velocity v_y after time t is v_y = qEs/mv_0.
The horizontal velocity v_x remains v_0.
The vertical velocity v_y is qEs/mv_0.
Given the angle of entry is 60 degrees, tan(60 degrees) = sqrt(3) = v_y/v_x = (qEs/mv_0)/v_0.
From the angle relation, s = mv_0^2 sqrt(3)/qE.
The distance from the particle's launch position to point P is s = mv_0^2 sqrt(3)/qE.
